text: ANNOUNCEMENTS: Resignation of Hon. Thilanga Sumathipala from Office of Deputy Speaker Land (Restrictions on Alienation) (Amendment) Bill: Petition to the Supreme Court
Unreleased Sections of the Bond Commission Report
QUESTION BY PRIVATE NOTICE: Control of Influenza Viral Fever
ELECTION OF DEPUTY SPEAKER AND CHAIRMAN OF COMMITTEES MUTUAL ASSISTANCE IN CRIMINAL MATTERS (AMENDMENT) BILL:
. The Parliament met at 1.00 p.m. MR. SPEAKER [THE HON. KARU JAYASURIYA] in the Chair.
RESIGNATION OF HON. THILANGA SUMATHIPALA FROM

SUPPLY OF COAL TO CEYLON ELECTRICITY BOARD: DETAILS 1.
asked the Minister of Power and Renewable Energy:
(a) Will he inform this House of-
(i) the total quantity of the coal supplied to the Ceylon Electricity Board by the company named Noble Resources Limited from time to time;
(ii) the total amount of money that has been paid to the said coal company in payment of these quantities;
(iii) the duration for which the operation of the Norochcholai Coal Power Station was interrupted for failure on the part of the said company to supply coal in time; and
(iv) the loss caused to the Ceylon Electricity Board due to interruption of generators in this manner?
(b) Will he also inform this House -
(i) the local representatives separately in respect of tenders numbered LCC/09/T/02, LCC/01 and LCC/13T/01 obtained by the Noble Resources Limited; and
(ii) the reasons for awarding the supply of coal to the said company without following the procurement procedure?
(c) If not, why? . ( . ) (The Hon. Ajith P. Perera) , .
. , Lanka Coal Company . . , Sectoral Oversight Committee , . . , Lanka Coal Company , . 2025
: CONSTRUCTION OF A RESERVOIR IN HOLOMBUWA AREA:
asked the Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources & Disaster Management:
(i) whether a reservoir will be built in the Holombuwa area of the Galigamuwa Electorate;

(ii) the number of ancient stupa, vihara and places of worship with historic significance that will be submerged in the waters of the said reservoir including Kotawehera of Dedigama and rock cave temple of Sthripura;
(iii) the number and the names of villages of the Galigamuwa and Dedigama Electorates that will be submerged in the waters of the said reservoir;
(iv) the number of families that will lose their lands in the aforesaid villages;
(v) whether there is a programme to divert water to Ma-Oya by a tunnel from Holombuwa;

(vi) whether he admits that the construction of a reservoir in an area like the aforesaid area which is not prone to any natural disaster, will have immense detrimental effects on the people of the said area?
( ) ( - , ) (The Hon. Palitha Range Bandara - State Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources and Disaster Management) , .
HALF TAX HOLIDAYS TO COMPANIES PROPOSED IN BUDGET
(i) in terms of Budget Proposal No. 130 of Budget 2016, whether a half tax holiday has been provided to the companies that introduce seeds that produce high yields; and
(ii) whether a list of companies which were granted with aforesaid tax holiday, will be submitted?
(b) Will he also inform this House -
(i) whether a list of machineries which were exempted from import taxes by 1st January 2015, will be submitted; and
(ii) whether a list of machineries which were exempted from import taxes by 1st January 2016 will be submitted; and
as proposals have been made to raise the import taxes on agricultural machineries, in terms of aforesaid Proposal?
( ) ( - ) (The Hon.Wasantha Aluvihare - State Minister of Agriculture) , .
: SMALL TANKS FED BY WAYAMBA CANAL PROJECT:
asked the Prime Minister and Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs:

(i) separately, in respect of each Grama Niladhari Division, the number of small tanks and weirs which are fed only by rain water presently, and which are situated in low elevation of the main canal in the downstream of 20 kilometres through Dambulla and Galewela Divisional Secretaries' Divisions and coming under the Wayamba Canal project operated by the Department of Irrigation under the Mahaweli Suraksithatha investment programme;
(ii) whether the Wayamba Canal feeds all the aforesaid tanks and weir systems;
(iii) whether plans have been made in that regard by now;
(iv) separately, the names of the tanks that are fed and not fed by the Wayamba Canal project;

(v) whether it does not cause an injustice to the farming communities of Dambulla and Galewela when water is provided to North Western Province without feeding the tanks and weirs that are located in low elevation of the main canal;
(vi) as a remedial action whether plans will be prepared and implemented in order to supply water to the tanks that are not fed; and
( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Weerakumara Dissanayake - State Minister of Mahaweli Development) , .
asked the Minister of Public Administration and Management and Law and Order:
(i) the date on which the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) was established;
(ii) the total number of complaints that had been received by the FCID as at 01.08.2017;
(iii) the number of complaints that have been referred to the Attorney Generals Department after completing investigations; and
(iv) separately the details of each complaint and the date on which each complaint was referred to the Attorney General's Department?
(b) If not, why? .. ( ) ( .. - ) (The Hon. R.M. Ranjith Madduma Bandara - Minister of Public Administration and Management and Law and Order)

DESTRUCTUION BY FLOODS IN COLOMBO DISTRICT IN
asked the Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources and Disaster Management:
(a) Will he inform this House in respect of the deluge caused by flooding and rain water in the Colombo District in May 2016-
(iii) the total amount of compensation paid on behalf of the government to affected persons;
(iv) the amount of compensation paid by the government for a deceased person;
(v) the maximum and minimum compensation paid to damaged houses;
(vi) whether permanent housing has been granted to all displaced persons; and
(vii) the nearest date on which a permanent house was granted to a displaced family?
asked the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development:
(i) houses were provided from Laksanda Sevana apartment complex in Salamulla on 01.12.2014 for 160 families that lost their houses as a result of expanding the garbage dump at Meethotamulla in 2012;
(ii) they were promised the provision of freehold title deeds by the Urban Development Authority within two months from the provision of those houses; and
(iii) those residents have not been provided with the title deeds up to now?
(i) the reasons for not providing the freehold title deeds; and
(ii) the exact date by which freehold title deeds for these houses could be provided by resolving any problems that prevail, if there are any?
( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka - Minister of Megapolis and Western Development) , .
( ) (The Hon. Speaker) . According to the Standing Orders you can ask only two Supplementary Questions.
COMMERCIAL LANDS IN EMBILIPITIYA TOWN: ISSUES
asked the Prime Minister and Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs:
(i) it is admitted that there is a issue when providing title deeds for plots of land for commercial purposes within rapidly developing Embilipitiya town in Ratnapura District; and
(ii) if so, the measures taken to provide title deeds properly?
(b) Will he also inform this House-
(i) whether he is aware, businessmen do not construct buildings in their business premises since a Buddhist temple claims right for the lands of this city;
(ii) the actual right pertaining to these lands by the temple; and
(iii) whether measures will be taken to grant the ownership of the relevant business premises
in this city to the businessmen who had possessed them for many years and facilities will be provided to the business community to engage in their business activities?
TILE FACTORY IN ODDUSUDAN : ALLOCATION FROM
asked the Minister of Public Enterprise and Kandy City Development :
(i) whether he is aware that the tile factory located in the Oddusudan Divisional Secretary's Division in the Mullaitivu District is no longer functioning;
(ii) what provision was allocated from the Budget 2016 for this factory;
(iii) through whom those funds were spent; and
(iv) the details of the activities carried out using these funds?
(b) If not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) , .
() . ( () ) (The Hon. (Mrs.) Shanthi Sriskandarasa) Hon. Minister. I know that some money has already been allocated for that from this year's Budget.

( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) We have not allocated any money from the Budget 2016. Your question is, " 2026 ?" You have asked about the allocation from the Budget 2016. But, we have not allocated any money in 2016.

.. ( .. ) (The Hon. M.A. Sumanthiran) Hon. Minister, we are aware that some monies have been spent supposedly on the allocation made in 2016. In the final speech of the Minister of Finance during the Budget 2016, he did mention this factory also and subsequently, some monies were allocated - not in the original allocation, but subsequently, some monies were allocated and some work had been started and later, stopped. - [Interruption.] The Hon. (Mrs.) Shanthi Sriskandarasa says that the work had also been completed, but the factory has not been made functional. So, that is the question that is being asked. Why is it not functioning?

( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) No. Her question was whether we allocated monies for that from the Budget 2016. We have not, but if you say some monies were allocated after that, I will look into it.
.. ( .. ) (The Hon. M.A. Sumanthiran) Monies were subsequently allocated and the factory was repaired, but it has not been made operational.
( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) I will look into it. .. ( .. ) (The Hon. M.A. Sumanthiran) Thank you.
() , ? asked the Minister of Public Enterprise and Kandy City Development :

(a) Will he inform this House- (i) whether he admits that the Employees Provident Fund contributions, Employees Trust Fund contributions and gratuity payments deducted from the salaries of the workers of the estates belonging to the Janatha Estates Development Board and the State Plantations Corporation had not been paid to the workers even at the end of 2016;
(ii) the number of workers employed in these
estates and the outstanding amounts to be paid to them, separately;
(iii) whether he admits that a grave injustice has
been caused to the family members of some of the workers who were to receive the payments and are now dead, as a result of not making those payments; and
(iv) whether steps would be taken to make those
payments to the workers immediately; and (v) if so, when? (b) If not, why?

( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Rajavarothiam Sampanthan - Leader of the Opposition) . . rose.

( ) (The Hon. Speaker) Hon. Leader of the Opposition. ( ) (The Hon. Rajavarothiam Sampanthan) Sir, as I was telling you, we have been working on the basis of a consensus in regard to the election of Speaker, Deputy Speaker and the Deputy Chairman of Committees. In terms of that consensual arrangement, Sir, as a Member of the United National Party, you are the Speaker and we have as the Deputy Chairman of Committees a Member from the TNA. I would urge that if the SLFP is proposing a name for the position of the Deputy Speaker, we accept that name in keeping with the tradition and work on the basis of consensus. My humble submission is that in keeping with the healthy tradition that has prevailed, if there is a proposal by the SLFP in regard to the position of Deputy Speaker, we bow to that proposal and accept that on the basis of the consensus of the whole House.
( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Ranil Wickremesinghe - Prime Minister, Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs} . . rose.

( ) (The Hon. Speaker) Hon. Prime Minister. ( ) (The Hon. Ranil Wickremesinghe) Hon. Speaker, on what the Leader of the Opposition said, the consensus was that we appoint the Speaker from the UNP as the Government Group and we have the Deputy Speaker from the Government Group who is a SLFP Member and the Deputy Chairman of Committees from the Opposition, which was different from earlier times where all three Members were from the Government Group. So, when the vacancy arose, I think the first name that the Government Group suggested was an SLFP Member from the Jaffna District. But some of the Parties were not willing. Therefore, since there were

no other backbenchers in the Government Group -they wanted people with more experience - we have now taken a backbencher from the UNP and recommended him as the Deputy Speaker. So, as long as it is from the Government Group, it does not matter to us. This is the only name that we have from the Members who sit in the Government. We want everyone to go along. But remember that the Speaker and the Deputy Speaker both were from the Government Group in a system where all the Members of the UNF and some Members of the SLFP formed the Government Group and then the position of Deputy Chairman of Committees went to a Member in the Opposition. That was all. I mean, there has never been a situation in which the Government had to take a minority. Always the Government had two Members and the Opposition had one Member. I think the first Member who was suggested from our side with the consensus was not acceptable to some of the Opposition Parties. Therefore, now, we have suggested another backbencher from the Government side, because we are keeping with the consensus that two Members are from the Government and one Member is from the Opposition, which is a new tradition because last time all three Members were from the Government.
( ) (The Hon. Speaker) That is a requirement. Ballot papers will be kept and destroyed. I will maintain the secrecy. I will be responsible for that.
( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) If it is a secret ballot, is it correct for us to sign? I think it is improper.
( ) (The Hon. Speaker) It is a requirement of the Standing Orders.
( ) (The Hon. Speaker) Hon. Leader of the Opposition.

( ) (The Hon. Rajavarothiam Sampanthan) Sir, I have heard the Hon. Prime Minister - in fact, the Hon. Prime Minister telephoned and spoke to me some days ago in regard to this matter. When he suggested the person he now has in mind, I told him even then that it may be better for us to agree on a nominee of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party for the post of Deputy Speaker. I
said that to him. I am stating here in Parliament what I said to the Hon. Prime Minister a few days ago.

I would urge, Sir, despite the initial thinking of the Prime Minister, we will reconsider this matter and if the Sri Lanka Freedom party is proposing a name for the post of Deputy Speaker, we accommodate that position and accept that person as the Deputy Speaker.
( ) (The Hon. Speaker) I have to act on the decision of the political parties. - [Interruption.] Hon. Prime Minister.

( ) (The Hon. Ranil Wickremesinghe) Hon. Leader of the Opposition, our convention is two Members from the Government, not two Members from the Opposition Benches. I mean, I have always maintained that position and when the Government first suggested a Member, it was you all who opposed it, not us. We did not oppose that Member. When the SLFP Ministers asked me, I said, All right, we have no objection. Speak to the others. So, when you all objected, we came up with another name. That is all. I mean, basically we have to keep it within the Government ranks - two Members from the Government.

So, I urge the Leader of the Opposition that we work in the same way because we have all so far worked together and we have bowed to your wishes in withdrawing the first candidate; the SLFP withdrew that candidate. We ourselves have bowed to your wishes. Not that we went and told the SLFP we do not want that Member. All we said was that it has to be a backbencher. So, it was your decision. As a result, now we have no one from the SLFP backbench in the Government ranks. None of their Deputy Ministers are willing to resign to take it over. Therefore, we have no option but to propose someone from the Government side who is a backbencher. So, I would ask the Leader of the Opposition to support us in upholding it. That is all that we are saying.
4.() . ( 4.() .) (Whereupon Division bells were rung under Standing Orders 4.(c).)
More than one Member having been proposed and seconded, the House proceeded to elect a Deputy Speaker by ballot.
. . Hon. Speaker declared the following results.
.. 97 ( )() 53 1 The Hon. J.M. Ananda Kumarasiri 97 votes The Hon. (Dr.) (Mrs.) Sudarshini Fernandopulle 53 votes Invalid 1

Presented by the Hon. Gayantha Karunatileka on behalf of the Minister of Justice and Prison Reforms; to be read a Second time upon Tuesday, 19th June, 2018 and to be printed; and to be referred to the relevant Sectoral Oversight Committee.
( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) Sir, I move,

''That notwithstanding the provisions of Standing Order No. 8 of the Parliament, the hours of sittings of Parliament on this day shall be 1.00 p.m. to 7.30 p.m. At 2.00 p.m. Standing Order No. 8(5) of the Parliament shall operate. At 7.30 p.m. Mr. Speaker shall adjourn the Parliament without question put.'' , . . Question put, and agreed to.
( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Mangala Samaraweera - Minister of Finance and Mass Media) , , , . TRC . . , .
( ) (The Hon. Speaker) ? ( ) (The Hon. Mangala Samaraweera) . ( ) (The Hon. Wimal Weerawansa) , TRC . . TRC . ; . TRC , ; . , .
() ( ) ( () - ) The Hon. (Dr.) Harsha De Silva - State Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs) . . rose. ( ) (The Hon. Speaker) , ?
( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) ,- ( ) (The Hon. Anura Dissanayake) , 9.30 .
( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) We can debate the Notifications under the Excise Ordinance for one hour and pass them. After that, we can take up the Adjournment Motion.
( ) (The Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena) No, we cannot, because we have five Notifications to debate, which are important. Those affect the country. So, we have to debate those.
( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) The Hon. Minister of Finance and Mass Media cannot come on Friday. That is the problem.
Parliament adjourned accordingly at 5.13 p.m. until 1.00 p.m. on Wednesday, 06th June, 2018.
Corrections which Members suggest for the Final Print should be clearly marked in their copy and sent to the Editor of HANSARD within two weeks
of receipt of the uncorrected copy.
